Caption: Sir C.V. Raman (left) and Dr. A.L. Mudaliar (right) greet each other with a handshake
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30thof July, 1966. . The Chief Guest and speaker for this historic event of the Institute was none other than Dr. C. V. Raman, the Indian physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the chairman of the Board of Governors presided over the ceremony. After being presented a Guard of Honor by the cadets of the N.C.C, Dr. C. V. Raman was received by Dr. A. L. Mudaliar, who introduced him to all the members of the council and senate members who were present at the occasion before proceeding to adorn the academic robes for the ceremony.
